name: OB/GYN - General

points: Unpredictable call for labor & deliveries 24/7
High malpractice liability stress
Constant fear of litigation ("perfect baby" pressure)
Can be called at any hour when patients go into labor
No control over timing of patient needs
Heavy patient volume with less time per patient
Long hours split between clinic and hospital
RVU/productivity pressure
Standardized care limiting individualized approach
Seeing more patients in less time
Administrative burden with EHR documentation
Legal uncertainty around abortion care
Moral injury from restricted evidence-based care
Fear of license loss or legal prosecution
Forced to delay care or consult attorneys
Complex, confusing state-specific restrictions
Physicians relocating due to restrictive state laws
Dealing with pregnancy loss and fetal anomalies
Emotional exhaustion from difficult cases
Compassion fatigue
Limited time to process grief between patients
Stillbirths and delivering babies with lethal anomalies
High emotional intensity of care during critical life stages
Difficulty maintaining work-life balance
Gender disparity challenges (80%+ female specialty)
Dual-career household coordination
Family time disrupted by unpredictable schedule
Female physicians 60% more likely to report burnout
Higher rates of reducing hours or taking time off (especially women <40)

motivations: Better work-life balance with predictable schedule
OB hospitalist model (shift-based, no personal call)
Reduced liability exposure and litigation stress
More time per patient for quality care
Practice autonomy and control over patient care

opening: Tell me about your current practice - what's your mix of OB versus GYN?
What's driving you to explore new opportunities at this point in your career?
Help me understand what you're hoping to find in your next position
painDiscovery: You mentioned [challenge] - help me understand how that's affecting your day-to-day
Tell me more about what led you to start looking for something different
Walk me through a typical week - where are the biggest pain points?
How has your call schedule been impacting you and your family?
What's your experience been with the post-Dobbs legal environment in your state?
Help me understand what aspects of your current situation need to change
clinical: Describe your OB volume - how many deliveries per month are you comfortable with?
Tell me about your comfort level with high-risk OB versus low-risk
Help me understand your GYN scope - office procedures, surgery preferences?
What's your experience with gynecologic surgery - minimally invasive, robotics?
Share your thoughts on call structure - what would be ideal for you?
Walk me through your patient volume expectations - daily clinic census?
Tell me about your interest in areas like adolescent GYN, menopause, urogynecology
How do you feel about hospital privileges versus ambulatory-only practice?
motivation: When you think about your ideal practice, what does it look like?
What would need to be true about a position for you to get excited about it?
Help me understand your priorities in making this next career move
Tell me about your long-term career goals - where do you see yourself in 5 years?
What aspects of OB/GYN do you find most rewarding?
compensation: Help me understand your current compensation structure - base, productivity bonus, benefits
When you think about your next position, what compensation package would make a move worthwhile?
Tell me about your financial goals and what's driving those expectations
How important is RVU-based versus salary-based compensation to you?

commonChallenges.response: Describe your ideal call structure - frequency, backup coverage, hospitalist support?
Help me understand what mix of OB versus GYN would be ideal - GYN-only, or just lower OB volume?
What states or practice settings would you feel most comfortable in legally?
What daily patient volume would feel sustainable for the quality of care you want to provide?
Tell me about your ideal practice environment for reducing liability exposure
Walk me through your ideal work schedule - days per week, weekends, time with family

challengingOpportunities: You mentioned wanting [specific preference]. Help me understand what underlying need that solves - there might be other ways to meet that same need
I hear you prefer avoiding [aspect]. If I could address your core concern through a different approach, would you be open to exploring it?
Many OB/GYNs find that the hospitalist model or GYN-focused practice solves their work-life balance issues - have you considered those options?
You mentioned geographic restrictions - what if we could find the lifestyle you want in a location you hadn't considered?
